author: Kallol Bhattacherjee
text:
Highlighting the government’s ‘neighbourhood-first’ foreign policy, a train load of Indian high speed diesel will reach Bangladesh on Saturday even as other bilateral projects declared during Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s 2015 Dhaka visit, are being fast-tracked.

The energy train, which started on Thursday from Siliguri, contains high speed diesel from the refinery at Numaligarh in Assam. It will reach Parbatipur in Bangladesh, where it will be received by Nasrul Hamid, Minister of State for Energy, Bangladesh.

The energy train will set the stage for inauguration of Indo-Bangla Friendship Pipeline between Numaligarh Refinery Ltd and Bangladesh Petroleum Corporation.
title: India sends diesel to Bangladesh
